metadata.Title: CVE-2020-24553 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Go before 1.14.8 and 1.15.x before 1.15.1 allows XSS because text/html is the default for CGI/FCGI handlers that lack a Content-Type header.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.10 - 1.10.4-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
golang-1.10-go - 1.10.4-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
golang-1.10-src - 1.10.4-2ubuntu1~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.4-2ubuntu1~18.04.2').
golang-1.13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
golang-1.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
golang-1.9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
